IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS IN THE FIELD OF LASER TECHNOLOGY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO FOSTER LASERS, LASER APPLICATIONS, AND LASER SAFETY WORLDWIDE.
IRS990.Desc: JOURNALS AND PUBLICATIONS - THE ORGANIZATION PUBLISHES, SELLS AND DISTRIBUTES SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL JOURNALS AND OTHER PUBLICATIONS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT LASER TECHNOLOGY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SHORT COURSES AND CONFERENCES - THE ORGANIZATION CONDUCTS SHORT COURSES AND CONFERENCES WHICH PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES REGARDING LASER TECHNOLOGY, APPLICATIONS, AND SAFETY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MEMBERSHIP - THE ORGANIZATION OFFERS MEMBERSHIPS WHICH ENTITLE MEMBERS TO RECEIVE CERTAIN JOURNALS AND PUBLICATIONS, AND REDUCED RATES ON SHORT COURSES AND SEMINARS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LINE 2- FINANCIAL STATEMENT FOOTNOTE ADDRESSING THE ORGANIZATION'S LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER ASC 740-10. INCOME TAXES- LASER INSTITUTE OF AMERICA IS AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE BOARD OR LASER SAFETY, INC. IS AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER 501(C)(6) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THUS, THE INSTITUE IS NOT SUBJECT TO THE FEDERAL OR STATE CORPORTATE INCOME TAX. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA PRESRIBE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE RECOGNITION OF INCOME TAXES IN FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND THE AMOUNTS RECOGNIZED ARE AFFECTED BY INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE INSTITUTE. LASER INSTITUTE OF AMERICA'S POSITION THAT IS IS TAX EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(6), AND THE POSITIONS THAT THE INCOME REPORTED ON THE 990-T IS THE ONLY RELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME AND THE EXPENSES REPORTED ON THE 990-T ARE DEDUCTIBLE AND ARE ALL DEFINED AS TAX POSITIONS UNDER THESE REQUIREMENTS. WHILE MANAGEMENT BELIEVES IT HAS COMPLIED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, THE SUSTAINABILITY OF SOME INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE INSTITUTE MAY BE UNCERTIAN. THERE ARE MINIMUM THRSHOLDS OF LIKELYHOOD THAT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ARE REQUIRED TO MEET BEFORE BEING RECOGNIZED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT THE INSTITUTE HAS ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT MARCH 31, 2018. IN THE EVENT INTEREST AND PENALTIES WERE DUE RELATED TO AN UNSUSTAINABLE TAX POSITION, THEY WOULD BE TREATED AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE.
FORMER EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PETER BAKER'S COMPENSATION FOR THE ENTIRE FISCAL YEAR 3/31/18 WAS BASED ON A SEVERANCE PAYMENT.
EXPENSES INCURRED IN PROVIDING VARIOUS OTHER NECESSARY EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT SERVICES TO ALL INDIVIDUALS IN A NON-DISCRIMATORY MANNER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A; QUESTION 6 & 7
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LASER INSTITUTE OF AMERICA HAS THE RIGHT TO ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THIS ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND HAS CERTIAN RESERVED POWERS AS DEFINED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE LASER INSTITUTE OF AMERICAN BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS DELEGATED TO THE CFO THE RESPONSIBILITY TO OVERSEE, REVIEW, AND APPORVE THE FEDERAL FORM 990, INCLUDING THE PREPARATION, REVIEW AND FILING PROCESS. AS PART OF THE TAX RETURN PREPARATION PROCESS THE ORGANIZATION HIRED A PROFESSIONAL CPA FIRM WITH EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE IS NOT-FOR-PROFIT TAX RETURN PREPARATION TO PREPARE THE FEDERAL FORM 990. THE CPA FIRM'S TAX PROFESSIONALS WORKED CLOSELY WITH THE ORGANIZTION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL AND VARIOUS OTHER INDIVIDUALS OF THE ORGANIZTION TO OBTAIN THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO PREPARE AND COMPLETE AN ACCURATE TAX RETURN. THE CPA FIRM PREPARED A DRAFT FEDERAL FORM 990 AND FURNISHED IT TO THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS FOR THEIR REVIEW. THE ORGANIZTION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS REVIEWED THE DRAFT FORM 990 AND DISCUSSED QUESTIONS AND COMMENTS WITH THE CPA FIRM. REVISIONS WERE MADE TO THE DRAFT FEDERAL FORM 990 WHERE NECESSARY AND A FINAL DRAFT WAS FURNISED BY THE CPA FIRM TO THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ANNUALLY ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, OFFICERS AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE EXISTING CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND COMPLETE A QUESTIONAIRE. EACH YEAR OFFICERS, DIRECTERS AND EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THEY HAVE IN WRITING. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE PRESIDENT OR EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. IT WOULD THEN BE DISCUSSED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND RECORDED IN THE MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: fORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B; QUESTION 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ("COMMITTEE"). THE COMMITTEE FOLLOWS THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA REQUIREMENTS WHEREBY THEY PRESENT A LETTER STATING THE SALARY IS JUST AND REASONABLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C; QUESTION 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES MAKE ANY OF THESE DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII AND SCHEDULE J
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART VII AND SCHEDULE J REFLECT CERTAIN BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS RECEIVING COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS FROM THE ORGANIZATION. PLEASE NOTE THIS REMUNERATION WAS FOR SERVICES RENDERED AS FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES OF THIS ORGANIZATION AND NOT FOR SERVICES RENDERED AS A VOTING MEMBER OR OFFICER OF THIS ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM AUDITED THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE TAXPAYER FOR THE YEARS ENDED MARCH 31, 2018 AND MARCH 31, 2017. AN UNMODIFIED OPINION WAS ISSUED BY THE INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM EACH YEAR. THE TAXPAYER'S AUDIT COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.
